newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain expects record number of tourists in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Spain expects record number of tourists in 1997.

text.p: The number of tourists visiting Spain will reach a record high in 1997, growing by between two and three percent from the previous year, State Secretary for Tourism Jose Manuel Fernandez Norniella said on Tuesday.
"1997 will be a good year for tourism in Spain," he told a press conference.
A record 41.3 million tourists visited Spain in 1996, generating an income of 3.5 billion pesetas ($24 million).
Fernandez Norniella said there were 21.4 million visitors in the first five months of 1997, an increase of 4.5 percent on the same period a year earlier.
Of the total number of visitors, 64 percent were catagorised as "tourists" while 36 percent were visitors on an excursion who did not stay overnight.
Fernandez Norniella said that a record number of visitors from England was expected -- even more than in 1994 when some eight million English visited Spain -- due to the strength of the pound.
The number of German visitors to Spain is expected to grow slightly, especially those heading for the Balearic Islands.
But the most spectacular rise will be in visitors from Nordic countries, he said.
